page.title: 05Housing in Chelmsley Wood
page.content: There are four different types of housing in Chelmsley Wood. Houses 43%, bungalows and other buildings 12%. The average rent is Â£16.79 and the average price of houses in the area is Â£18,000-Â£19,000. Two thirds of all tenants receive help of some form. Unemployment is high in the area and problems occur when paying rent. However, old age pensioners are said to be the best payers! Caretakers are employed to manage some of the council flats and maisonettes and the council also provides a warden service for the elderly living in flats and bungalows. Between 1982 and 1987 the council will have demolished 350 flats and maisonettes of around 25 years old. At present flats and maisonettes account for 45% of the total housing of Chelmsley Wood.
